TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Rss20ItemFormatter extends System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter implements class System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable

Docs.summary: A class that serializes a instance to and from RSS 2.0 format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this class to serialize instances of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and to create an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> from an XML document that represents an RSS 2.0 item. If you have derived a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and want to serialize it, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20ItemFormatter%601> formatter.
## Examples The following code shows how to create a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance and serialize it.
[!code-csharp[RssFormatter#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/rssformatter/cs/snippets.cs#7)] [!code-vb[RssFormatter#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/rssformatter/vb/snippets.vb#7)]

Docs.param: A value that specifies whether to serialize elements that are defined in the Atom 1.0 specification but not in the RSS 2.0 specification. The default value is .
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the `serializeExtensionsAsAtom` parameter is `true`, all elements defined in the Atom 1.0 specification that are not defined in the RSS 2.0 specification are serialized with the Atom 1.0 namespace.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem CreateItemInstance() cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks The newly created <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance is not automatically associated with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20ItemFormatter> used to create it.

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the syndication item associated with the .
Docs.value: The type of the syndication item associated with the .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to preserve attribute extensions during serialization.
Docs.value: A value that specifies whether to preserve attribute extensions during serialization.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value of this property is `true`. Attribute extensions are XML attributes that are not defined in the Atom 1.0 specification. This property determines whether to write these attributes during serialization. Similarly, this property determines whether to preserve attribute extensions inside the `AttributeExtensions` properties in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance when deserializing an RSS 2.0 item.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to preserve element extensions during serialization.
Docs.value: A value that specifies whether to preserve element extensions during serialization.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value of this property is `true`. Element extensions are XML elements that are not defined in the Atom 1.0 specification. This property determines whether to write these elements during serialization. Similarly, this property determines whether to preserve element extensions inside the `ElementExtensions` property in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance when deserializing an RSS 2.0 item.

Docs.summary: Gets and sets a value that specifies whether to serialize extensions within the Atom 1.0 namespace.
Docs.value: A value that specifies whether to serialize extensions within the Atom 1.0 namespace.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value of this property is `true`. When this property is `true`, any properties in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> class that cannot be represented in the RSS 2.0 format are serialized within the Atom 1.0 namespace; otherwise these properties are not be serialized.
